full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 September 23, 1966 To my employer, My name is Betty Mao. I am a professional domestic for 30 years. Part of time I worked at my own home and for Chinese families, About more than ten years I worked for American families. Many of them I didn't ask for reference letter. Many reference letters given by my former employers have been lost. The following references from my previous employers areii hand at present:- Joan M. Stuckart, for 2 years Paul G. Stuckart, for 17 months Jeannett Cavinese, for 1 year M. Danielsen, for 16 months Glenn C. Johnso, for 2 months I have done every work of domestic, such as baby care, child care, bath children, do general housework, laundering, iron, set table, serve at table, mend clothes, and cooking in English or Chinese style. I like American friends very much, and every employer of mine treated me very well. Therefore I wish to go to America and work in their families for my life. Bettf We
